conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a cutaway/roof-removed axonometric view with extruded walls (height + thickness) and readable interior volumes; not a recolored 2D plan.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and floor plane separation; interior volumes read well. View is slightly angled/axonometric with multiple wall faces visible. Cutaway is clean with minor simplification at some wall tops/edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set and adjacency largely match (living/dining left-bottom, kitchen right, playroom top-right, stairs top-center, small bath/closet zone top-left). Some proportional/partition differences are noticeable in the central service core (pantry/utility area) and a few wall runs appear shifted/reshaped relative to the 2D plan. Openings (doors/windows) are present but not all placements/sizes can be confirmed as exact.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present and assigned to appropriate rooms (living seating, dining table, kitchen cabinets/island, playroom furniture). Bathroom fixtures are included. Scales/orientations are generally plausible with minor simplification.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are distinguishable with consistent materials and good readability. Lighting is even and does not obscure geometry. Minor clarity loss from near-top-down angle and simplified window/door detailing.

detected_errors.description: Some layout/proportion deviations in the central pantry/utility partitioning compared with the 2D plan (service core geometry appears simplified/shifted).
Door/window locations and sizes are not perfectly verifiable against the 2D plan; several openings appear generalized rather than dimension-accurate.
Furniture is simplified and may not reflect exact clearances; however, it is largely consistent with inferred room functions.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, with minor-to-moderate deviations in service-core partition geometry and some generalized openings.
